title: Saurabh Singh
text:
I am a Senior Data Analyst & BI Lead with over 12 years of experience.
My focus is on the practical application of data strategy. I don’t claim to be a Cloud Architect; I am a strategist who builds reliable reporting engines.



Engineering: Building reliable data pipelines and governance models (SQL/BigQuery).
Intelligence: Designing executive dashboards that drive action (Tableau/Power BI).
Analysis: Applying statistical rigor to business ambiguity.

The Architecture
To solve this, I implemented a tiered lineage strategy.






flowchart LR
  A[qmd] --> B(Knitr)
  A[qmd] --> C(Jupyter)
  B(Knitr) --> D[md]
  C(Jupyter) --> D[md]
  D[md] --> E(pandoc)
  E(pandoc) --> F(HTML)
  E(pandoc) --> G(PDF)
  E(pandoc) --> H(Word)
  E(pandoc) --> I{and more}




Figure 1: How Quarto orchestrates rendering of documents: start with a qmd file, use the Knitr or Jupyter engine to perform the computations and convert it to an md file, then use Pandoc to convert to various file formats including HTML, PDF, and Word.
